definition: to delay/to hold up/to waste time/to interfere with

sentences.english: Presently she started up, exclaiming that they wouldbe late for breakfast;
sentences.chinese: 不一会儿她跳了起来，嚷着他们要耽误早饭了。

sentences.english: Don't blame me for the delay.
If the mother delays, she may lose her chance to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 如果耽误时间，她可能就会丧失睡觉的机会。

sentences.english: He missed the bus, because he got up late.
sentences.chinese: 他因为起床晚耽误了坐公共汽车。

sentences.english: Well send teams to avoid, or would delay your school.
sentences.chinese: 免得派队嘛，不然会耽误你上学的。

sentences.english: We have no time to lose.
We hope you can make a direct shipment as any transshipment will delay the arrival of goods .
sentences.chinese: 希望贵方能采用直运方式，因为转运会耽误货期。

sentences.english: Time lost through illness amounted to 1,357 working days.
sentences.chinese: 由于疾病而耽误的工作日达到1357天。

sentences.english: And clean neat, do not delay to work.
sentences.chinese: 等拾掇齐整了，还不耽误下地干活。

sentences.english: He procrastinated until it was too late to do anything.
sentences.chinese: 他拖延耽误以致一事无成。

sentences.english: The hour’s delay was most annoying.
sentences.chinese: 这时候耽误是最令人烦恼的。

sentences.english: Therefore, all riders should pay attention to, and not by this to the delay.
sentences.chinese: 所以所有车友要注意了，不要被这个给耽误了。

sentences.english: This feature cram has increasingly delayed the next generation of the operating system.
sentences.chinese: 这种特性充塞已越来越耽误下一代操作系统。

sentences.english: I've no time to wait or sigh.
sentences.chinese: 我不能在这里耽误时间。

sentences.english: Therefore, it is hoped that you will open it in time in order not to delay shipment.
sentences.chinese: 因此，希望你方及时开证，以免耽误装运。

sentences.english: It also costs time invisibly that we reject the goods which are not satisfying.
sentences.chinese: 虽然货物不满意可以拒收，但无形之中也耽误了时间。

definition: to worry/to feel anxious/Taiwan pr. [zhao1 ji2]
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
to make a journey for nothing
to collapse/to be worn out/to break down
to snatch time/to rush/to hurry (up)/to seize the moment
